intro: Riedelia schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's riedelia, is a rare and striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
